item.title: Fuck Spammers
item.dc:creator: @mihalich mihalich
item.description:
@mihalich wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:30, topic:399673”][quote author=mihalich link=topic=496804.msg3641626#msg3641626 date=1309042834]

they should add a right click report for the chat box
[/quote]That’s actually a pretty good idea, you should request that on the official forums…

People have suggested that before and the response back was that making reporting that much easier would result in a major increase in false reports and would actually slow down their banning/muting. I agree tho that it should still be added since I don’t think they’ll get more false reports but more actual reports that deserve a punishment.

In 317’s when you right clicked on players with admin rights wasn’t there an option to kick/ban?[/quote]
-.-

Read full topic

item.title: Fuck Spammers
item.dc:creator: @tinyscape TinyScape
item.description:
@tinyscape wrote:

[quote=“DevilsCape, post:16, topic:399673”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=496804.msg3633200#msg3633200 date=1308406665]

rotfl …

sorry for free world babies …

the world now is full of spammers …

sorry 4 them …

if those spammers were real … about selling money … y’d they come to free world? rotfl … if free world players were able to pay for gold y they arent member?

those website who sells gold and spam … in f2p dont they think?? sigh

++ if they were real … y r they afraid ?? y r they afraid to pay 6$ on a membership in order to find better ppl who wants to get scammed ?

Well gold sites aren’t going to pay $5 for an account to spam that will be muted the second a player mod see’s it. That wouldn’t make any sense.
[/quote]

it wouldnt also make any sense advertising in f2p ??

if f2p players were able to pay 4 gold y didnt they pay to be member? ;D

or what do u think??

and jagex … can easily IP-BAN them??

but i guess their lazy sigh[/quote]Many spammers will advertise in a f2p world as there aint that many player mods.

Read full topic
